channel.title: gutenbergtimes tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from gutenbergtimes.

item.description: Using Classic Widgets with Blocked-Based Themes: Introducing the Legacy Widget Block Plugin by @justintadlock https://t.co/WVymmARs7e

Learn more about the new "Create Block Theme" plugin by the WordPress Themes team Ben Dwyer @scruffian wrote on who it is for, how it works and why it's not part of the Gutenberg repo https://t.co/Fzjr1DLs6c via @WordPress

WordPress 6.1 Planning, FSE Studio and more -- Weekend Edition 220 curated by Birgit Pauli-Haack @bph with contributions by @pollyplummer @priethor @mikemcalister @bgardner @wpwatercooler #WordPress https://t.co/Ye9vq1aaQL

Reserve your seat for the next Gutenberg Times Live Q & A: July 22, 2022 at 11 am EDT / 15:00 UTC https://t.co/73M7OYt2py A Block-First Approach at Pew Research Center w/ lead developer Seth Rubenstein @SethRubenstein and head of digital strategy, Michael Piccorossi @mpiccorossi https://t.co/NOIxvZn1d8
Anatomy of a Block Theme https://t.co/u3KU15kWms via @WordPressTV Quickly learn the key components of what makes up a block theme.
Block editor styles: initiatives and goals https://t.co/55QGfSSYML via @WordPress

84 Block Themes, Reusable Blocks, Create-Block-Theme-Plugin hand-curated by Birgit Pauli-Haack @bph with contributions by @get_dave @matias_ventura @dumitru @karks88 @richard_tabor @extendify @nickmdiego @kathyzant https://t.co/VjxUAtKpbE

Block First Approach, Gutenberg 13.4, Page vs Site Editor - Weekend Edition 218 with contributions among others by @jeffikus @m_munirkamal @GeorginaReeder @nickmdiego @get_dave @martinibuster @matias_ventura https://t.co/ugN2uoJnn7

The Museum of Block Art is now offering an official way to submit your art. Explore the power of the editor, create something wonderful, and give back to the community all at once. https://t.co/UGP3rvhkNm
